content.text: Before explaining how the script works first we need to look at the below script once:

#!/usr/bin/env python3

 

import subprocess

import optparse

import re

 

def get_arguments():

   parser = optparse.OptionParser()

   parser.add_option("-i", "--interface", dest="interface", help="Name of the Interface")

   parser.add_option("-m", "--mac", dest="new_mac", help="New Mac Address")

   (options, arguments)=parser.parse_args()

   if not options.interface:

       parser.error("[-] Please specify interface, see --help for help")

   elif not options.new_mac:

       parser.error("[-] Please specify new mac, see --help for help")

   return options

 

def mac_change(interface,new_mac):

   print("[+] Changing mac of "+interface+" to "+new_mac)

   subprocess.call(["sudo", "ifconfig", interface, "down"])

   subprocess.call(["sudo", "ifconfig", interface, "hw", "ether", new_mac])

   subprocess.call(["sudo", "ifconfig", interface, "up"])

 

def get_current_mac(interface):

   ifconfig_result=subprocess.check_output(["ifconfig", interface])

   current_mac=re.search(r"\w\w:\w\w:\w\w:\w\w:\w\w:\w\w", str(ifconfig_result))

   if current_mac:

       return current_mac.group(0)

   else:

       print("[-] Could not retrieve mac")

 

options=get_arguments()

current_mac=get_current_mac(options.interface)

print("Current Mac="+str(current_mac))

mac_change(options.interface,options.new_mac)

current_mac=get_current_mac(options.interface)

print("Changed Mac="+str(current_mac))

if current_mac==options.new_mac:

   print("[+] Command Executed SuccessFully!")

else:

   print("[-] Command Did Not Execute Successfully")

 

print("[+] Happy Hacking!")

In the above script, the subprocess is used to directly run Operating system commands, optparser is a tool used for parsing the options and re for regular expressions. In this first, we added various options using getarguments() function then as then name suggests we extract current mac from the ifconfig command using regular expression in getcurrentmac function. mac_change function takes two arguments interface name and the new mac address and executes regular linux commands to change mac as can be seen in the function.

People in New Delhi and some other Metro cities of India are currently suffocating due to unhealthy air pollution levels. The poisonous skies in India are caused in part by the burning of crops wastes in Punjab and Haryana. Add to that the poisonous fumes gratefulness to the cracker-bursting during Diwali celebrations and the metropolitan traffic, you find yourself in a deadly gas chamber with extremely high levels of air pollution.

 

The World Index has published some data which shows that the people living in India, inhaling all the pollution air, may have lost a significant amount of life expectancy. According to the data released by World Index, Indians may have lost an expected 1.5 years of life expectancy due to the current air pollution levels.

This may not appear like a large number, but it's a significant loss. We're not only discussing people who are living in New Delhi here. The current air pollution levels are affecting the people living in other metro cities too, like Bangalore, for example.

 

It's also worth pointing out that we're not just arguing about the adults and children who are suffering right now. We must also consider the unborn children and other living beings entering the world in such unfavorable conditions.

India isn't the only country that's currently suffering due to air pollution. Other countries like Bangladesh, Egypt, Nepal, Afghanistan, etc. are also suffering, showing that air pollution is a serious problem and must be taken more threateningly. Until the air pollution levels go back to the normal state, we highly recommend you stay indoors as much as possible and wear anti-air pollution masks and use the air purifiers inside your residence too.

content.text:
Operational Effectiveness Is Not Strategy - Companies must be ﬂexible to respond rapidly to competitive and market changes. Positioning—once the heart of strategy—is rejected as too static for today’s dynamic markets and changing technologies.

The root of the problem is the failure to distinguish between operational effectiveness and strategy. As managers push to improve on all fronts, they move farther away from viable competitive positions.

Operational  Effectiveness: Necessary but Not Sufficient - Both essential to superior performance, which, after all, is the primary goal of any enterprise.  A company can outperform rivals only if it can establish a difference that it can preserve. Delivering greater value allows a company to charge higher average unit prices; greater efficiency results in lower average unit costs. 

Cost is generated by performing activities, and cost advantage arises from performing particular activities more efficiently than competitors. Differentiation arises from both the choice of activities and how they are performed.

Operational effectiveness (OE) means performing similar activities better than rivals perform them.

Example of activities that enhance OE: 

  • Get more out of their inputs than others. 
  • Eliminate wasted effort. 
  • Employ more advanced technology. 
  • Motivate employees better. 
  • Greater insight into managing particular activities or sets of activities. 

Tips that enhance OE:

  1. Get more out of their inputs than others
  2. Eliminate waste efforts
  3. Employ more advanced technology
  4. Motivate employees better
  5. Greater insights into managing particular activities or set of activities

Productivity frontier: Sum of all existing best practices at any given time. Lowest possible cost delivering the highest value. The productivity frontier is constantly shifting outward as new technologies and management approaches are developed and as new inputs become available. Constant improvement in operational effectiveness is necessary to achieve superior proﬁtability. OE competition shifts the productivity frontier outward, effectively raising the bar for everyone.

The strategy rests on unique activities

The essence of strategy is in the activities—choosing to perform activities differently or to perform different activities than rivals. Otherwise, a strategy is nothing more than a marketing slogan that will not withstand competition.

The Origins of Strategic Positions: Strategic positions emerge from three distinct sources

  1. variety-based positioning because it is based on the choice of product or service varieties rather than customer segments makes economic sense when a company can best produce particular products or services using distinctive sets of activities.
  2. needs-based positioning, which comes closer to traditional thinking about targeting a segment of customers. Arises when there are groups of customers with differing needs, and when a tailored set of activities can serve those needs best.
  3. access-based positioning Segmenting customers who are accessible in different ways. Although their needs are similar to those of other customers.

Having deﬁned positioning, we can now begin to answer the question, “What is strategy?” A strategy is the creation of a unique and valuable position, involving a different set of activities. If there were only one ideal position, there would be no need for strategy.

A Sustainable Strategic Position Requires Trade-offs

Trade-offs arise for three reasons

  1. Inconsistencies in image or reputation - A company is known for delivering one kind of value that may lack credibility and confuse customers—or even undermine its reputation—if it delivers another kind of value or attempts to deliver two inconsistent things at the same time.
  2. Trade-offs arise from activities themselves
  3. Trade-offs arise from limits on internal coordination and control

Positioning trade-offs are pervasive in competition and essential to strategy. At the frontier, where companies have achieved current best practice, the trade-off between cost and differentiation is very real indeed.

The strategy is making trade-offs in competing. The essence of strategy is choosing what not to do.

Fit Drives Both Competitive Advantage and Sustainability

Fit locks out imitators by creating a chain that is as strong as its strongest link

Types of Fit.

  1. The first-order ﬁt – is simple consistency between each activity (function) and the overall strategy
  2. Second-order fit – occurs when activities are reinforcing.
  3. Third-order ﬁt - optimization of effort

Coordination and information exchange across activities to eliminate redundancy and minimize wasted effort are the most basic types of effort optimization. Strategic ﬁt among many activities is fundamental not only to competitive advantage but also to the sustainability of that advantage. The more a company’s positioning rests on activity systems with second- and third-order ﬁt, the more sustainable its advantage will be. A strategy is creating ﬁt among a company’s activities. The success of a strategy depends on doing many things well— not just a few—and integrating among them.

title: Summary of "What Is Strategy?" By: Michael E. Porter
feature_content: In this article, we will present a summary of one of the famous articles on Strategy by Michael E. Porter discussing the concepts of operational efficiency, strategic positioning, productivity frontier, etc.

content.text:
The Elements of a Strategy

  1. Arenas: where will be active?
  2. Vehicles: how will we get there?
  3. Differentiators: how will we win in the marketplace?
  4. Staging: What will be our speed and sequence of moves?
  5. Economic Logic: how will we obtain our returns?

Arenas: In articulating arenas, it is important to be as specific as possible about the product categories, market segments, geographic areas, and core technologies, as well as the value-adding stages (e.g., product design, manufacturing, selling, servicing, and distribution) the business intends to take on. In choosing arenas, the strategist needs to indicate not only where the business will be active, but also how much emphasis will be placed on each.

Vehicles: Beyond deciding on the arenas in which the business will be active, the strategist also needs to decide how to get there. If we have decided to expand our product range, are we going to accomplish that by relying on organic, internal product development, or are there other vehicles—such as joint ventures or acquisitions— that offer a better means for achieving our broadened scope? If we are committed to international expansion, what should be our primary modes, or vehicles—Greenfield startups, local acquisitions, licensing, or joint ventures? Failure to explicitly consider and articulate the intended expansion vehicles can result in the hoped-for entry's being seriously delayed, unnecessarily costly, or totally stalled.

Differentiators: In a competitive world, winning is the result of differentiators, and such edges don't just happen. Rather, they require executives to make up-front, conscious choices about which weapons will be assembled, honed, and deployed to beat competitors in the fight for customers, revenues, and profits. Achieving a compelling marketplace advantage does not necessarily mean that the company has to be at the extreme on one differentiating dimension; rather, sometimes having the best combination of differentiators confers a tremendous marketplace advantage.

Staging: Decisions about staging can be driven by a number of factors. One, of course, is resources. Urgency is a second-factor affecting staging; some elements of a strategy may face brief windows of opportunity, requiring that they are pursued first and aggressively. A third factor is the achievement of credibility. A fourth factor is the pursuit of early wins.

Economic Logic: At the heart of a business strategy must be a clear idea of how profits will be generated—not just some profits, but profits above the firm's cost of capital. It is not enough to vaguely count on having revenues that are above costs. Unless there's a compelling basis for it, customers and competitors won't let that happen. The most successful strategies have a central economic logic that serves as the fulcrum for profit creation.

title: Elements Of A Strategy
feature_content: In this article, we will discuss the core elements of the strategy “Arenas”, “Staging”, “Vehicles”, “Differentiation” and “Economic Logic” and what they are.

Indian brands that have improved the country emerge on the world stage and make a global presence across the globe. We might have come across different types of brands in India.

The brand names are cool and catchy. Let’s take a look at the brands that you assumed were foreign but are Indian-based brands.

 

Royal Enfield:

A long time ago, Royal Enfield was owned by a British cruiser fabricating organization but at present, the automobile brand is an auxiliary of Eicher Motors Limited, an Indian automaker with industrial plants located in Chennai.

 

Munich Polo:

We might believe that Munich Polo is a German-based brand. However, it is just another Indian brand that is one of the top brands for kids’ clothing.

 

American Swan:

People might think that if the word ‘American’ is used in a brand, then it is considered as an American brand. But that’s not a foreign-based brand. American Swan is an Indian based brand that is claimed by The American Swan Lifestyle Company and its central unit is located in Gurgaon.

 

Louis Philippe:

Louis Philippe, the brand which was once owned by King Louis Philippe, the King of French (1830) was purchased by Madura Fashion and Lifestyle in 1989 and hence it became an Indian brand now.

 

Flying Machine:

‘Flying Machine’ – going by the name alone, it triggers us to think that it is a foreign-based brand but this is made in India. Interestingly, this was India’s first homegrown denim brand which was started in the year 1980 by Arvind Lifestyle Brand Ltd.

 

Peter England:

In case if you assumed Peter England is from England, you’re wrong. It is not from England but is from India.

 

Monte Carlo:

There is no doubt that Monte Carlo is one of the most favored brands by people in India. Monte Carlo is quite popular for its sweaters and Italian name. However, it is really a 100% Indian woolen wear brand from the Ludhiana-based Nahar Group.

 

CCD:

Café Coffee Day, which is an Indian café chain made people fall in love with their tasty coffee. CCD is actually a subsidiary of Coffee Day Enterprises Limited. Coffee Day serves as many as 1.6 billion cups of coffee annually across six nations.

The Indian-based brand has global exposure. CCDs are in Austria, Czech Republic, Malaysia, Nepal, and Egypt.

 

Allen Solly:

Allen Solly is not a foreign brand. It is a backup of the Aditya Birla Group and authorized under Madura Garments. With unique and traditional thinking, they have brought about a revolution in Indian formal wear in the last two decades.

title: Brands that you assumed were ‘Foreign’ but are ‘Indian’ actually

content.text:
Websockets are mainly used for realtime updates, chat system and many other applications that require real-time data. Websockets are built on TCP protocol that is established via Http. The connection is kept alive between client and server so that updates can be triggered on both the ends.

Let's now see WebSockets in action through an example code:

We are using socket.io for web sockets, first import socket.io and than hook it with Http,after which we are listening to on connection and disconnect events and changing the value of visitors accordingly.

Server Code:

const express = require('express');

const socketIO = require('socket.io');

const http = require('http');

 

const app = express();

 

let server = http.createServer(app);

let io = socketIO(server);

 

let numClients = 0;

 

io.on('connection', (socket) => {

   numClients++;

   io.emit('count', { numClients: numClients });

   console.log('Connected clients:', numClients);

 

   socket.on('disconnect', function() {

       numClients--;

       io.emit('count', { numClients: numClients });

 

       console.log('Connected clients:', numClients);

   });

});

 

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 5000;

 

server.listen(PORT);
Now we need to add client code as below:

<script src="/socket.io/socket.io.js"></script>

<script>

   var socket = io.connect('/');

   socket.on('stats', function(data) {

       let clients = data.numClients;

       document.getElementById("activeClients").innerHTML = "Active Users: " + clients;

       console.log('Connected clients:', data.numClients);

   });

</script>

<div id="activeClients"></div>

content.text:
Jenkins is an open-source software using which we can set up continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) pipelines in our ubuntu. Continuous integration (CI) is a DevOps practice in which member of our team can regularly commit their code changes and push to the version control repository, after which automated build pipelines and test pipelines are triggered. Continuous delivery (CD) is a process in where code changes are automatically built, tested, and deployed to the desired environment (production, staging, or any other).

In this article, we will install Jenkins on an Ubuntu 18.04 machine using the Jenkins Debian package repository.

We will be using a Long Term Support release

An LTS (Long-Term Support) release is chosen every 12 weeks from the stream of regular releases as the stable release for that time period. It can be installed from the debian-stable apt repository.

Installing Jenkins

To install Jenkins on your Ubuntu system, follow these steps:

  • Install Java. (Since Jenkins is a Java application, the first step is to install Java. Update the package index and install the Java 8 OpenJDK package with the following commands) to install java run the following line of code.

sudo apt update

sudo apt install openjdk-8-jdk

You know sudo apt-get update command gets you an updated list of packages from the Internet to your local machine and sudo apt install openjdk-8-jdk will install java to your system. If you have multiple versions of Java installed on your machine make sure java 8 is the default version.

Add Jenkins repository:

  1. Import the Jenkins repository GPG keys using the following wget command:
wget -q -O - https://pkg.jenkins.io/debian/jenkins.io.key | sudo apt-key add -

This command means that the key has been successfully imported and packages from this repository will be considered trusted and it should print OK for sure.

Now add the Jenkins repository to the system using the below command
sudo sh -c 'echo deb http://pkg.jenkins.io/debian-stable binary/ > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/jenkins.list
Now install Jenkins:
sudo apt install jenkins

The above command will install Jenkins to our ubuntu system, it will automatically start it once the installation is successfully completed.

We can verify the status of Jenkins by printing it using the service command.
sudo service jenkins status
If you want to stop Jenkins you can use following command
sudo service jenkins stop
If you want to restart Jenkins you can use the following command
sudo service jenkins restart

Adjusting the Firewall for remote access:

If you are installing Jenkins on a remote Ubuntu server that is protected from remote port access by a firewall you’ll need to open port 8080 so that it should be available to be used from outside. If you are using UFW to manage your firewall, you can open the port with the following command:
sudo ufw allow 8080

Setting Up Jenkins 

Now we will complete the setup of your new Jenkins installation, open your browser, type your domain or IP address followed by port 8080, http://your_ip_or_domain:8080 and screen similar to the following will be displayed:
During the installation, the Jenkins installer creates an initial 32-character long alphanumeric password. Use the following command to print the password on your terminal:
sudo cat /var/lib/jenkins/secrets/initialAdminPassword
It will print a one time password on your screen, something like this

Now you need to copy the password from your terminal, paste it into the Administrator password field in your browser, and click Continue to proceed further.

On the next screen, the setup will ask you to install suggested plugins or specific plugins, you can choose to install suggested plugins, as shown in the photo below
You need to wait until all the plugins are installed,  on the next screen just enter the required information to create a new admin user, and click SAVE AND CONTINUE

On the next screen, you will be asked to set the URL of your Jenkins instance for remote access, the URL field will be automatically populated with your default IP or domain, You just need to click on SAVE AND FINISH.

Now just click on the Start using Jenkins button and you will be redirected to the Jenkins dashboard logged in as the admin user you have created in one of the previous steps using your username and password details.

title: How to install jenkins in ubuntu
feature_content: In this article, we will install Jenkins in ubuntu to setup continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) pipelines using the Jenkins Debian package repository

content.text:
Operational Excellence is one of the 3 value disciplines which a company focuses on while providing value to its customers. By operational excellence, we mean providing the customers with reliable products at competitive prices while making the delivery as convenient as possible for them. It is a strategic approach towards the production and delivery of the product or service with the goal of becoming a leader in terms of price and convenience.

In the mid-1980s, Compaq and IBM were racing to make a better PC. During this period, Dell was founded by Michael Dell and its operation started in his dormitory room at the University of Texas in Austin. While Compaq was focused on making faster and less expensive computers than IBM, Dell decided to focus on making a better Delivery system.

Dell came into the market with a unique and efficient operating model for operational excellence. Compaq was selling PCs through dealers to novices, while Dell came up with a model that removed dealers from the distribution process altogether. Dell created an extremely low-cost culture organization, selling to customers directly and building to order instead of keeping any inventory. It was able to undercut all other players in the market while providing high-quality products to its customers. It showed customers that they did not need to sacrifice quality or good specs in order to buy a PC at an affordable price. 

Focusing on an operational excellence strategy, gave Dell a competitive edge in the market. Though it is necessary to be alert as gaining a competitive advantage and sustaining it is very different. Organizations must keep on improving their strategy and look for more innovative ways to perfect the operation. Even the smallest improvement can help stay competitive in the market.

title: Dell - A Master of Operational Excellence
feature_content: In this article, we will discuss how Dell has achieved exceptional operational efficiency and gained a competitive advantage over other competitors.

content.text:
Customer Intimacy is one of the 3 value disciplines which a company focuses on while providing value to its customers. Customer intimacy means segmenting and targeting its customer base while also customizing its offering to fulfill the demand or the needs of that segment. The company that focuses on providing value to the customers through this strategy has a more flexible operation to customize its products as per any request made by the customer. They also keep a detailed knowledge base on their customers. In doing so they are able to connect with the customers at a deeper level and engender tremendous customer loyalty.

Home Depot is a fine example of how to provide value to its customers by focusing on customer intimacy. It is the largest home improvement retailer in the United States, supplying tools, construction products, and services. The clerks at Home depot will spend whatever time it takes for the customer to find whatever they are looking for, or even guide them with what products can use to solve their repair problems. Their first priority is to make sure that the customer is satisfied. They are not in a hurry, be it the customer needs something worth only a few cents.

This may seem like a bad deal, considering the cost incurred in a single transaction with low returns, but customer intimacy companies don’t care about profit from a single transaction, but they look at the customer’s lifetime value. The company is not only selling products to the customers, but they are also providing them with the information they need. Customers whose only concern is price do not fall under there targeted core segment.

title: Customer Intimacy : The Home Depot Way
feature_content: In this article, we will discuss what is Customer Intimacy and how is The Home Depot is leveraging it.

content.text:
A dead elephant is worth 76 times than a living one. The same goes for dead celebrities. It is a bleak reality of showbusiness. 

Michael Jackson earned more than 1 $ Billion posthumously from the partial sale of the Beatles-heavy Sony/ATV music publishing catalog.

The film industry (Including Us) has a tradition of applauding people post-death. 

  • Paul Walker (Fast & Furious star) tribute song "See you again" got 4.6 Billion views.
  • David Bowie's album "Bowie – Legacy, the Greatest Hits" made record sales five months after his death making $ 55 Mn to Sony.
  • The same story goes for Elvis Presley, Marilyn Monroe, Frank Sinatra, Audrey Hepburn, etc.

Sushant Singh Rajput was born on 21st January 1986 in Patna, India died on 14th June 2020 is the latest one from our own "Nepotism Driven" Bollywood, who failed such a great personality & now "Dil Bechara" is a super hit on Hotstar & becoming No.1 rated Indian Movie on IMDB.

Marilyn Monroe born on June 1, 1926, in Los Angeles, US died on August 5, 1962, is an American actress who became a major sex symbol and starred in multiple commercial successful motions pictures. At the time of death, Marilyn Monroe's asset was worth $10 Million while today, her name earns $13 Million every year.

Michael Jackson is popularly known as the “King of Pop” born on August 29, 1958, in Indiana the US died on June 25, 2009. He had a debt of $500 Million when he died while his personality estate bought for $1 Billion by Sony, Warner Bros & MCA. His Licensing rights earned $60 Million in 2018.

Elvis Persley was born on January 8, 1935, in Mississippi, the US died on August 16, 1977. He is often referred to as the “King of Rock and Roll”.
